name: Hidaya Foundation
mission: PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL, SOCIAL WELFARE AND CHARITABLE ASSISTANCE TO ECONOMICALLY DEPRESSED AREAS
theoryOfChange: Belief that education combined with social welfare (addressing hunger and health) creates a comprehensive solution for community well-being.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.hidaya.org/zakat (Source: https://www.hidaya.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 40/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

judge_issues.message: The rationale for the governance component is missing. The governance score is 0/10 due to unknown board members, which is a significant factor affecting the overall impact score and should be mentioned in the rationale.

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: HIDAYA FOUNDATION shows strong alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.hidaya.org/zakat (Source: https://www.hidaya.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: Hidaya Foundation focuses on providing educational, social welfare, and charitable assistance to economically depressed areas.
The charity is Zakat-eligible and follows specific policies for asnaf categories.
The organization reported a 95.0% program expense ratio and total revenue of $15,472,301.
Financial data indicates the foundation holds 3.5 months of working capital.
The foundation achieved a fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised.
The foundation offers multiple giving methods for donors to support humanitarian and religious causes.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a 68/100 score due to its high program efficiency and strong alignment with humanitarian causes, though its overall score is moderated by medium data confidence and moderate working capital levels.
areas_for_improvement: Working capital reserves are relatively lean at 3.5 months.
Enhancing third-party impact reporting could further boost data confidence scores.

dimension_explanations.alignment: Hidaya Foundation shows high donor fit for those seeking humanitarian impact, specifically through its Zakat-eligible programs that adhere to traditional asnaf categories [2]. The organization addresses urgent humanitarian needs across education and social welfare sectors, establishing a consistent track record of service [1][7].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a direct service model with a cost per beneficiary of approximately $35.22, maintaining a 95.0% program expense ratio [3][6]. While the financial health is stable with $15,472,301 in total revenue, the working capital of 3.5 months suggests a need for careful liquidity management [5][6].

baseline_narrative.headline: Hidaya Foundation provides critical humanitarian aid and social welfare services to economically depressed regions through a highly efficient, Zakat-eligible operational model.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 95.0%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries.
High fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.02 to raise every $1.
Strong alignment with Muslim donor requirements through verified Zakat eligibility.
baseline_narrative.summary: Hidaya Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing educational, social welfare, and charitable assistance to impoverished communities [1][3]. The foundation is Zakat-eligible, allowing Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various humanitarian programs [2][7].

all_citations.quote: Hidaya Foundation accepts Zakat donations and distributes them to the deserving.
Financial Statements for the year ended 2024

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a 68/100 score due to its high program efficiency and strong alignment with humanitarian causes, though its overall score is moderated by medium data confidence and moderate working capital levels.

areas_for_improvement.context: While program delivery is efficient, the foundation should <cite id="1">seek external evaluation</cite> to verify long-term outcomes beyond output metrics.
The organization would benefit from <cite id="1">documenting a clear theory of change</cite> with an explicit causal pathway to improve its impact score.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization undergoes regular audits but does not have a full BBB Wise Giving Alliance accreditation on file.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's 25+ year history and audited financials mitigate some concerns regarding operational stability.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">Evidence and outcomes are currently unverified</cite> by third parties
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="1">lack of verified external impact data</cite> and a developing theory of change.

confidence.notes: Financial data is highly reliable, but impact evidence is self-reported.

alignment.explanation: The charity is a strong fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="2">verified Zakat eligibility</cite> and serving <cite id="1">underserved populations</cite> in 10+ countries.
alignment.improvement: Further alignment could be achieved by <cite id="1">expanding services to geographies</cite> with even more limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust the foundation's financial reporting due to <cite id="6">consistent independent audits</cite> and an <cite id="1">80% independent board</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the foundation could publish more detailed <cite id="1">board governance policies</cite> and member biographies.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly direct, with <cite id="1">95.0% of expenses</cite> reaching programs and a <cite id="1">resilient 3.5 months of working capital</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="1">tracking outcomes over at least 3 years</cite> and commissioning external evaluations.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Developing theory of change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Distributes significant funds to specialized partners for local implementation.

rich_narrative.headline: Hidaya Foundation provides critical humanitarian aid and social welfare services to economically depressed regions through a highly efficient, Zakat-eligible operational model.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize extreme financial efficiency and want to ensure the maximum percentage of their Zakat reaches the poor through an established institution.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill Zakat obligations with a verified provider
Value low overhead and high program expense ratios
Prefer supporting a wide range of social welfare programs simultaneously
Trust organizations with a long-standing (25+ year) track record
giving_considerations: Gifts support a mix of direct implementation and grants to other partners
The organization focuses on output efficiency over academic impact studies
Operations are concentrated in high-need but politically complex regions
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors who require rigorous, third-party Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT) evidence of impact before giving.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects high financial efficiency and output tracking, but a lack of independent, external impact evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The foundation creates impact by providing direct aid and grants for education, health, and social welfare to break the cycle of poverty.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: External evidence ensures that high spending on programs translates into measurable, long-term improvements for beneficiaries.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of 11.5%</cite> and vast humanitarian needs in its target regions, the foundation has significant capacity to scale.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="1">95.0% program ratio</cite>, which is significantly higher than the <cite id="1">peer median of 89.8%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on orphan care and humanitarian relief
similar_organizations.name: Baitulmaal, Inc.

strengths.detail: The foundation maintains a <cite id="1">95.0% program expense ratio</cite> and a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="1">$0.02 per $1 raised</cite>, far exceeding industry standards.
Hidaya provides a clear <cite id="2">Zakat policy</cite> and ensures funds reach eligible recipients such as the <cite id="2">poor and needy (fuqara and masakin)</cite>.
Operating since <cite id="1">1999</cite>, the organization has demonstrated stability with a <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of 11.5%</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Hidaya Foundation's operational model is built on extreme cost-containment. By utilizing a <cite id="1">direct service delivery model</cite>, they achieve a cost-per-beneficiary of approximately <cite id="1">$35.22</cite>, which is considered exceptional for international humanitarian work. Their financial transparency is bolstered by <cite id="6">audited financial statements</cite> that confirm a consistent ability to direct over 90% of total spending toward programs like education, healthcare, and self-employment.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1999</cite>, Hidaya Foundation is a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing educational, social welfare, and charitable assistance to <cite id="3">economically depressed areas</cite> globally. The organization operates with a highly efficient financial model, reporting <cite id="3">$15,472,301 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. A hallmark of their operations is a <cite id="1">95.0% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor contributions directly fund service delivery rather than administrative overhead. Their reach is extensive, with active programs in <cite id="1">Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Afghanistan, and several African nations</cite> including Somalia and Ethiopia. Hidaya Foundation is <cite id="2">verified as Zakat-eligible</cite>, maintaining a dedicated policy to ensure <cite id="2">100% of Zakat donations</cite> are distributed to eligible asnaf categories. The organization's fundraising model is exceptionally lean, spending only <cite id="1">$0.02 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions. This efficiency is supported by a <cite id="3">$11.5 million grantmaking program</cite> that distributes aid through both domestic and foreign partners to maximize on-the-ground impact.
